summary: Automated security report identifying 8 vulnerabilities in transitive dependencies of the core package, with the highest severity being 7.8 (CVE-2021-43138 in async library). The issue was automatically closed when the vulnerable dependencies were removed or updated.
userImpact: Users are exposed to multiple high-severity security vulnerabilities through transitive dependencies in the SDK, potentially affecting the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of applications using this version.
rootCause: Outdated transitive dependencies (async-2.6.3, node-forge-1.2.1, ansi-regex, trim, nth-check, shelljs) with known CVEs were included in the build.
proposedFix: Upgrade vulnerable libraries: async to v3.2.2, ansi-regex to 5.0.1/6.0.1, node-forge to a patched version, and update other affected dependencies (trim, nth-check, shelljs).
resolutionDetails: Automatically closed by WhiteSource when vulnerable dependencies were removed or updated in the inventory.
keyQuote: Found 8 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 7.8) - This issue was automatically closed by WhiteSource because the vulnerable library in the specific branch(es) was either marked as ignored or it is no longer part of the WhiteSource inventory.
